meanings.definition: The quality or state of being selective.
meanings.sent1: Her selectivities in choosing friends always led her to the most loyal companions.
meanings.sent2: The selectivities of the chef in picking ingredients for the dish made it truly exceptional.
meanings.sent3: His selectivities in deciding which movie to watch often resulted in watching the same film over and over.
meanings.sent4: The selectivities of nature in determining which species survive in an ecosystem are truly fascinating.
meanings.sent5: The selectivities of the admissions committee ensured only the most qualified candidates were accepted.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a substance or compound can be selectively separated or transformed in a chemical process.
meanings.sent1: The selectivities of the filtration process determined the purity of the final product.
meanings.sent2: Chemists study the selectivities of reactions to understand how to control product formation.
meanings.sent3: The selectivities of the separating funnel made the chemistry experiment more interesting than expected.
meanings.sent4: The selectivities of the catalyst in the reaction were crucial for the desired outcome.
meanings.sent5: The selectivities of the enzyme allowed for the specific breakdown of the substrate.
